author: Newsfile
title: Ready to Launch Cybria Mainnet: An Innovative Blend of Blockchain and Artificial Intelligence | User | mammothtimes.com
text:
Transformative Launch Marks a New Era for Cybria Ecosystem
Istanbul, Turkey--(Newsfile Corp. - December 28, 2023) - In August 2023, Cybria embarked on a groundbreaking journey with the ambitious mission of spearheading a blockchain revolution. The destination: Cybria Mainnet - an innovative platform seamlessly fusing blockchain technology and Artificial Intelligence (AI) is set to launch on December 30, 2023. This transformative venture is poised to elevate the Ethereum ecosystem by enhancing scalability, transaction speed, and security.
Cybria Mainnet Ready to Launch on December 30, 2023
Cybria Layer 2
Cybria operates as a Layer 2 blockchain platform strategically positioned on the Ethereum network. Designed to augment scalability and bolster transaction efficiency, Cybria leverages the power of Cybersecurity and AI technologies to fortify network safety and optimize performance. The marriage of blockchain and AI opens doors to novel applications across diverse domains, underscoring the pivotal role AI plays in advancing various aspects of Cybria.
The Evolution of AI Integration
The journey commenced with the experimental Testnet v1, which evolved into the more robust v2. This evolution marked the advent of a new Layer 2 Blockchain solution, one supercharged by AI capabilities. The integration of AI into blockchain technology signifies a leap towards innovative and powerful applications, setting the stage for Cybria's imminent impact.
Launching Cybria Mainnet: December 30, 2023
After four months of anticipation, the Cybria Mainnet launch is set to launch on December 30, 2023. This milestone event will not only unveil the Mainnet but also introduce the Cybria Bridge and Cybria Swap, key components that will animate the Cyba Ecosystem. The launch heralds a new era of possibilities, where the synergy of blockchain and AI is set to redefine the digital landscape.
Cybria Bridge and Swap
The Cybria Bridge stands as a gateway for the seamless transfer of digital assets and data between Ethereum and Cybria. At the Mainnet release, the Ethereum-Cyba Chain Bridge will be available, facilitating the fluid movement of assets. Simultaneously, the Cybria Swap empowers users to transact on the Cyba Chain while enhancing liquidity, providing a comprehensive solution for those entering the Cyba ecosystem.
With the inauguration of Cybria Mainnet, enthusiasts and early adopters are invited to join the Cyba ecosystem and embark on a journey of innovation and growth. Cybria Mainnet represents not only a technical milestone but a pivotal moment in the evolution of blockchain and AI integration.
In summary, the launch of Cybria Mainnet marks a turning point in the realm of blockchain technology, signaling a future where the fusion of AI and blockchain redefines the possibilities within the digital landscape.

Whitepaper: https://docs.cybria.io/

author: Karla Baylon
title: Suspenden 30 centros de rehabilitaci√≥n en BC
text:
Suspenden 30 centros de rehabilitaci√≥n en BC
En el a√±o se han realizado aproximadamente 140 visitas a centros de rehabilitaci√≥n, de las cuales 30 derivaron en suspensiones
Mexicali, Baja California.- Al menos 30 [centros de rehabilitaci√≥n](https://www.elimparcial.com/mxl/mexicali/2024/04/23/han-sido-detectados-dos-centros-de-rehabilitacion-sin-regular-en-lo-que-va-del-2024/) han sido suspendidos por la Comisi√≥n Estatal para la Protecci√≥n contra Riesgos Sanitarios (COEPRIS) debido al manejo de medicamentos o alimentos en mal estado, inform√≥ el titular, Rigoberto Izarraraz Hern√°ndez.
El doctor declar√≥ que tanto el Instituto de Psiquiatr√≠a del Estado de Baja California (IPEBC) como la COEPRIS tienen competencia para revisar que los centros de rehabilitaci√≥n operen de manera correcta.
Explic√≥ que el IPEBC se encarga de regular la atenci√≥n m√©dica de la adicci√≥n y de que se cumplan los requisitos de la Norma 028, mientras que la COEPRIS revisa las condiciones sanitarias y las autorizaciones de los establecimientos.
‚ÄúSi es un establecimiento mixto que tiene √°rea de desintoxicaci√≥n, debe tener un responsable m√©dico. Este tiene un horario registrado que debe cumplir y es el encargado de valorar a los pacientes, determinar el estado en el que llegan y definir el tratamiento [de desintoxicaci√≥n ](https://www.elimparcial.com/mxl/mexicali/2024/05/30/tiene-mexicali-54-centros-de-rehabilitacion-registrados-en-el-ipebc/)que llevar√°n‚Äù, se√±al√≥.
Indic√≥ que en el a√±o se han realizado aproximadamente 140 visitas a centros de rehabilitaci√≥n, de las cuales 30 derivaron en suspensiones, de un total de 288 centros registrados ante el IPEBC, de los cuales 191 ya cuentan con acreditaci√≥n.
Una de las principales problem√°ticas dentro de los centros de rehabilitaci√≥n es la falta de constancia en los servicios m√©dicos en aquellos que reciben pacientes en estado de intoxicaci√≥n, adem√°s de la saturaci√≥n de estos.
El tiempo de suspensi√≥n depender√° de la causa: si es por una falta administrativa, ser√° temporal; si implica un riesgo al paciente, se aplicar√° una multa.
Suspenden centro de rehabilitaci√≥n Nueva Vida
El centro de rehabilitaci√≥n Nueva Vida es uno de los que recientemente fue suspendido en Mexicali por la COEPRIS, as√≠ lo confirm√≥ el titular. Esto ocurri√≥ luego de que se presentara una denuncia por la muerte de un hombre.
Denisse, pareja sentimental del hoy occiso, relat√≥ a La Cr√≥nica que acus√≥ al centro de tener fallas en su operaci√≥n, lo que ocasion√≥ una omisi√≥n que cost√≥ la vida a su exesposo, padre de su hijo.
Sigue nuestro canal de WhatsApp
Recibe las noticias m√°s importantes del d√≠a. Da click [aqu√≠](https://www.elimparcial.com/boletin-whatsapp/)

organizations.name: Comisi√≥n Estatal para la Protecci√≥n contra Riesgos Sanitarios

author: KHOU
title: Houston allocates $459 million for drainage after court ruling - NewsBreak
text:
Houston
Houston allocates $459 million for drainage after court ruling
1 hours ago
HOUSTON ‚Äî Houston city officials have agreed to allocate hundreds of millions of dollars for drainage projects following a Texas Supreme Court ruling that found the city had failed to comply with a voter-approved amendment designating funds for this purpose. After months of discussions, the city has reached a...

author: times news cr
title: Bolzanini away from Valencia: ¬´The city is in chaos¬ª ‚Äì News
text:
BOLZANO. The strong wind, the incessant rain and the message from‚Å£ the ‚Å£Spanish ‚Äãgovernment on ‚Å¢all cell phones in ‚Å¢the‚Äã region: ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt leave your house.‚Äù ‚Å¢For i Bolzanians on holiday‚Äå in Valencia for the Sharm‚Äã week it ‚Å£was a shock. Locked‚Å§ in a hotel, they experienced the ‚Å£most dramatic days for ‚ÄãSpain in recent decades.
¬´The weather forecast was‚Äå rain, but we certainly never expected a storm of this type ‚Äì he‚Äã says Diana B ., returned on Wednesday ‚Å£- Fortunately our area, between the city of‚Å¢ science and the sea,‚Å§ was less affected ‚Äãthan the others‚Äù. She and her group were among the‚Äç few ‚Å§who managed to catch the‚Äã flight home on Wednesday. Dozens were ‚Å£cancelled, ‚Å§plus, due to the flooded streets ‚Å£and the ‚Å£closed subway, it‚Äç was almost impossible to reach the‚Å¢ airport.
Another Bolzano girl, Raffaella Less who returned yesterday from holidays‚Å£ in Valencia, took off ‚Äçon‚Å£ the return plane and ‚Å£witnessed ‚Å§an ‚Å§apocalyptic‚Äã scenario. ¬´We saw all the ‚Äãflooded areas. In the city we didn‚Äôt realize the extent of the‚Äå disaster, ‚Äãalso ‚Å£because the area around‚Äã the port, where we were staying, was not particularly affected. We‚Äå felt the strong‚Å¢ wind, yes. And in the night a terrible rain, never felt before. I ‚Äåthought of Emilia Romagna.‚Äù
On Tuesday evening the group of holidaymakers from Bolzano were sitting at the restaurant table when, suddenly, all the phones in the room started‚Å¢ ringing. ‚Å¢It was the civil protection alert, activated at around 7.30pm, hours after the‚Å£ start of the disaster. ¬´We‚Å£ all rushed out. ‚Äì ‚Äçsays Raffaella Less ‚Äì An absurd wind was blowing‚Å§ outside. We ‚Äåheard ‚Äåfrom citizens that ‚Äçthe‚Å§ largest floods occurred between ‚Äå4 and 5 in the afternoon. ‚Å£The‚Äå alarm came much later‚Ä¶ There must have been a flaw‚Äã in ‚Äåthe system.‚Äù
On ‚Äåthe road, he explains, there were fallen trees, but nothing‚Äã to suggest what was happening a ‚Å£few kilometers‚Äå further ‚Äãnorth. Public transport in‚Å¢ the‚Äå city‚Äå immediately went haywire.‚Äå ‚ÄúWe started ‚Äådesperately ‚Äçlooking for a ‚Äçtaxi: ‚Äãwe‚Å§ were all on the street trying to hail one,‚Äù says ‚Å£Less.
Moving was ‚Å§also dramatic for Diana and her group. ¬´We were ‚Å§supposed to‚Å§ catch the return flight at ‚Å¢6pm on Wednesday. ‚Äì he says ‚Äì Finding a taxi was a challenge. The city was in complete chaos. Getting‚Äå to the airport was impossible, the drivers lied ‚Å£to the police at‚Å§ the checkpoint about ‚Å¢where they were going,‚Äå because otherwise they would have sent them back. We were afraid of finding ourselves stuck along ‚Å¢a ‚Å¢flooded road.‚Äù
Christian Alderucci a ‚Å¢former hockey player‚Å¢ from Bolzano, never ‚Å§made it to ‚Å£Valencia: he left yesterday on a ‚Äãflight from Italy and‚Å¢ was landed as an emergency‚Äå in Malaga. A few hours later ‚Äãhe decided to go back, like him many‚Å§ other Italians. ‚ÄúThere were‚Äã no means of transport to‚Äç reach Valencia ‚Äì he said when reached by phone‚Å£ ‚Äì I had to stay in Spain ‚Å§until Saturday, but it makes no sense to visit the city in those conditions‚Äù.‚Å§ Like everyone, he is shocked ‚Å§by the images broadcast by the international‚Äç media.
Interview between‚Äç Time.news Editor ‚Å§and Weather Expert: Dr. Elena Torrens
Time.news Editor: ‚Å£Good afternoon, Dr. Torrens. Thank you for joining‚Å¢ us today. We‚Äôre here to discuss the recent ‚Å£severe weather event that struck Valencia, ‚Å£affecting many holidaymakers, including several from Bolzano. Can you first give us a brief‚Å§ overview of what caused‚Äç this unexpected storm?
Dr. Elena Torrens: ‚Å§ Good ‚Äåafternoon! Absolutely, it‚Äôs great to be ‚Äåhere. The storms ‚Å¢in Valencia were primarily ‚Å¢caused by a combination ‚Å§of unusually warm sea temperatures and a‚Äã low-pressure system that‚Äã moved into‚Äç the area. This‚Äã created a perfect storm scenario, leading to intense rainfall, strong winds, and ultimately‚Å§ flash flooding. While we can typically predict rain, storms of‚Äã this‚Äã magnitude‚Å¢ are more challenging.
Time.news Editor: It sounds‚Å§ incredibly alarming. We heard from travelers like Diana‚Å§ B. and Raffaella Less who experienced sudden alerts from the government to stay indoors. What typically triggers such alerts, ‚Äåand was this response ‚Äåtimely enough?
Dr. Elena Torrens: ‚Äã Civil protection alerts are usually triggered when the situation poses a significant threat to life and property. In this case, the alert came late relative to when the worst conditions began, as Raffaella mentioned. The response systems depend on real-time data and forecasts that unfortunately may not always align perfectly with the fast-changing conditions in‚Å¢ severe weather events. In‚Äç this instance, the delayed warning ‚Äçmay have reflected a flaw‚Äå in the communication system between meteorological forecasts and civil authorities.
Time.news Editor: That‚Äôs quite concerning. Raffaella shared that she thought of Emilia Romagna, likely referencing‚Å£ the ‚Å¢devastating floods that impacted that region earlier. How do you assess the climate patterns in Spain, especially considering ‚Å¢the potential for more intense weather ‚Å¢events due to climate change?
Dr. Elena Torrens: You‚Äôre right to draw ‚Å§that connection. ‚Å£Spain, like many parts of the world, is‚Äã experiencing changes ‚Äãin climate patterns, which contribute to more extreme weather events. Increased temperatures can lead to more moisture in‚Äã the‚Å§ atmosphere, resulting‚Å¢ in heavier ‚Äçrainfall during storms. This is not just a localized issue; ‚Å¢it‚Äôs a symptom of a global trend, and regions that traditionally weren‚Äôt prone to such severe weather are now vulnerable.
Time.news Editor: That‚Äôs‚Å£ a sobering thought. What advice can you‚Äç give to travelers about staying safe during‚Äã such unpredictable weather, especially when they are far from home?
Dr. Elena Torrens: My primary advice is to stay informed. Travelers should monitor reliable weather channels and local ‚Å§news for real-time updates. Additionally, having a plan in place, knowing the nearest evacuation routes,‚Äå and understanding local ‚Äåemergency protocols can be vital. It‚Äôs also wise‚Å¢ to‚Å¢ have a few basic supplies on hand,‚Äç such ‚Å§as water and non-perishable food, just in case.
Time.news‚Äç Editor: Excellent advice, Dr. Torrens. As we wrap ‚Äãup, how‚Äç can communities better prepare for and respond to these increasingly severe weather events in the future?
Dr. Elena Torrens: Communities‚Å£ need to invest‚Äç in robust infrastructure that can handle extreme weather, improve early warning systems, and enhance public‚Äå awareness campaigns concerning emergency preparedness. Collaboration with experts in meteorology and civil defense is crucial. Ultimately, fostering community resilience can greatly mitigate the impacts of such disasters.
Time.news Editor: Thank you for your insights, Dr. Torrens. It‚Äôs crucial information for both travelers and communities. ‚ÄãWe ‚Äãappreciate your time and expertise today.
Dr.‚Å£ Elena Torrens: Thank you for having me. Stay safe, everyone!

author: Nitesh Kumar
title: A 300kg powerlifting goal that proved fatal for 17-year-old prodigy in Bikaner
text:
A 300kg powerlifting goal that proved fatal for 17-year-old prodigy in Bikaner
Jaipur: Powerlifting champion Yashtika Acharya who died in a freak gym accident this week had one goal ‚Äî to lift 300kg. The 17-year-old from Bikaner aimed for this milestone to help her bag another gold at the upcoming national championship in Jammu and Kashmir. Her drive to achieve the target was so intense it kept her in the gym for hours, pushing her to the limits at an age when most of her peers were still mulling over career choices.
Her promising sporting career ended too soon, however, when the 270kg barbell slipped and crushed her neck during training Tuesday night.
Ganesh Acharya, owner of the Bikaner gym where the incident occurred, said Yashtika had unwavering focus. "She wanted to reach the 300kg mark. In Oct 2024, she won gold at the National Equipped Bench Press Championship in Goa, lifting 250kg. The second runner-up in the junior category lifted about 200kg. This time, she was determined to break her own record in the tournament she planned to participate in next month," Acharya told TOI Thursday.
Yashtika's dedication and determination often meant sacrificing things most teenagers like her would cherish. She skipped a family wedding in Hanumangarh, unwilling to miss even a few days of training.

author: Brett T.
title: Gov. Kathy Hochul Assures New Yorkers She's 'Stockpiling Abortion Medication'
text: New York Gov. Kathy Hochul is a true believer, even more liberal than her predecessor Andrew Cuomo. Earlier this year, when she heard about Florida's "disgraceful and dangerous" six-week abortion ban, she assured Floridians that New York would be their "safe harbor" where they could get an abortion at any time for any reason. News flash: People are fleeing New York and moving to Florida because they can't take it anymore. Hochul put out a graphic of the actions the governor's office was taking to protect the fundamental freedoms of New Yorkers, such as the right to bear arms. OK, we're just kidding about this one; instead, she brags about New York's gun control laws. And as far as protecting abortion access, the state is "stockpiling abortion medication" so they'll have plenty of "medication" on hand when Donald Trump bans the abortion pill in his nationwide abortion ban. New York is the birthplace of the women‚Äôs rights, LGBTQ+ rights, environmental justice, and American labor movement. We have always been a bastion for rule of law and for freedom ‚Äî and we always will be. ‚Äî Governor Kathy Hochul (@GovKathyHochul)[pic.twitter.com/ivFiuNDMum][November 7, 2024] New York will always be a bastion of freedom. Your state officials just raided a man's house, confiscated his rescue pets and then murdered them under these 'freedom laws,' you're so proud of. ‚Äî Chad Felix Greene üáÆüá± (@chadfelixg)[November 7, 2024] She never said anything about the freedom to keep a pet squirrel in your house. Fundamental Freedoms? ‚Äî Meredith (@Opportunitweet) The NY government violated civil rights by shutting businesses, closing places of worship and schools, and denying families access to society if one or all of them didn't get an injection. This is Hochul's NY legacy.[November 7, 2024] You threw a guy in prison for POSTING MEMES that he DIDN'T EVEN CREATE. ‚Äî Rochester Radar (@RochesterRadar) Don't you DARE talk about ANYONE'S freedoms. Witch.[November 7, 2024] Didn't you guys just do a raid on a squirrel? Maybe a little more focus on subway crime, yes? ‚Äî old_jester (@old_jester1968)[November 7, 2024] And let‚Äôs not forget out of control CRIME and cashless bail laws ‚Äî Isaac Reshad (@ReshadIsaac)[November 7, 2024] God go away already, literally no one elected you ‚Äî screamingnance73 (@GeeEmm73)[November 7, 2024] Glad to see yall are learning nothing from this. Should bode well for my side in a couple of yesrs ‚Äî SCIENCE!! (@RaschDecisions)[November 7, 2024] Usually I like to tell you to cut the crap, but I think you should keep going. Keep digging your own hole. We'll throw your ass in it in 2026. Make sure it's big enough for you and Tish!! ‚Äî Amy (@Queendom916)[November 7, 2024] Your dumb shit gun control is yet another thing pushing people farther right. The majority of Americans don't have "ban guns" as a priority. ‚Äî Mildly Annoyed Red Guy (@LifeDtf) Way to be out of touch. "nation-leading gun laws" my ass.[November 7, 2024] Anything on keeping criminals out of the streets? ‚Äî JediofTatuin (@JediofTatuin)[November 7, 2024] Hochul is very concerned about the fundamental freedoms of criminals. This list is exactly why Trump won. Not too bright doubling down on it. ‚Äî üá∫üá∏ü¶ãdemogirlü¶ãüá∫üá∏ (@demogirl17) ‚ÄúStockpiling abortion medication‚Äù Just WOW[November 7, 2024] "Abortion medication" ‚Äî that's even more disingenuous than calling abortion "female health care." ***

author: Elijah
title: SpaceX has a plan for Starlink to reach Gigabit speeds
text:
SpaceX is seeking approval for changes to Starlink that the company says will enable gigabits-per-second broadband service. in a application submitted to the US Federal Communications Commission on October 11, SpaceX claims The ‚Äúrequested modification and accompanying amendment will enable the Gen2 system to deliver gigabit-speed broadband, truly low-latency broadband, and ubiquitous mobile connectivity to all Americans and the billions of people around the world who still lack access to adequate broadband.
SpaceX said it is pursuing ‚Äúseveral small but significant updates to the orbital configuration and operating parameters for the authorization of its Gen2 space station to improve space sustainability, better respond to changing demand, and share spectrum more efficiently with other space users.‚Äù spectrum‚Äù.
SpaceX wants to reduce the altitude of the satellites ‚Äúfrom 525 km, 530 km and 535 km to 480 km, 485 km and 475 km altitude, respectively.‚Äù The reconfiguration will increase the ‚Äúpotential maximum number of orbital aircraft and satellites per aircraft‚Äù and keep the total planned number of second-generation satellites at 29,988 or less. The FCC so far approved 7,500 Gen2 satellites.
Elon Musk, CEO of SpaceX wrote On Monday, ‚Äúnext-generation Starlink satellites, which are so large that only Starship can launch them, will enable a 10-fold increase in bandwidth and, with reduced altitude, faster latency.‚Äù
SpaceX promised gigabit speeds in 2016, when the satellite system was just in the planning stages and didn‚Äôt even have a name yet. ‚ÄúOnce fully optimized through final deployment, the system will be able to provide high bandwidth (up to 1 Gbps per user) and low-latency broadband services to consumers and businesses in the US and around the world.‚Äù SpaceX told the FCC in November 2016.
As for actual speeds in 2024, Starlink website says that ‚Äúusers typically experience download speeds between 25 and 220 Mbps, with most users experiencing speeds greater than 100 Mbps. Upload speeds are typically between 5 and 20 Mbps. Latency ranges from 25 to 60 ms on land, and more than 100 ms in certain remote locations.‚Äù
Change satellite elevation angles Another request would change satellite elevation angles to improve network performance, SpaceX said. ‚ÄúSpaceX is seeking to reduce its minimum elevation angle from 25 degrees to 20 degrees for satellites operating between 400 and 500 kilometers altitude,‚Äù SpaceX told the FCC. ‚ÄúReducing the minimum elevation angle in this way will improve customer connectivity by allowing satellites to connect directly to more ground stations and maintain connections with ground stations for a longer period of time while flying overhead.‚Äù
Meanwhile, upgrades to Starlink‚Äôs Gen2 satellites ‚Äúwill feature improved hardware that can utilize higher gain and more advanced beamforming and digital processing technologies and provide more targeted and robust coverage for U.S. consumers,‚Äù SpaceX said. .
SpaceX is also seeking more flexible use of spectrum licenses to support its planned mobile service and current home Internet service. The company requested permission ‚Äúto use Ka, V and E band frequencies for fixed or mobile satellite use cases where the US or International Frequency Allocation Table allows such dual use and where the antenna parameters would be indistinguishable.‚Äù ‚Äú.

author: Jace Frederick
title: Pioneer Press Player of the Year: Tartan's CJ Banks
text:
Ask C.J. Banks what drew him to basketball, and he won‚Äôt hesitate to answer.
‚ÄúThe competitiveness,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs why I love it.‚ÄùWith that in mind, it should come as no surprise that the 5-foot-11 guard was such a big-game hunter for Tartan throughout his high school career.The game that will always stick in Titans coach Mark Klingsporn‚Äôs mind is the team‚Äôs section semifinal upset of East Ridge last year, when Banks was a junior. The guard dropped 24 points to snap the Raptors‚Äô 16-game winning streak.‚ÄúHe was utterly fantastic,‚Äù Klingsporn said. ‚ÄúAnd he really needed to be for us to pull that off. ‚Ä¶ We wouldn‚Äôt have been even close without how great he played in that game.‚ÄùThe coach noted that game revealed to many just how special Banks was, and could be. The guard provided further additional evidence in his senior season.Banks ‚Äî the Pioneer Press East Metro Boys Basketball Player of the Year ‚Äî averaged 18.7 points and 5.5 assists while leading Tartan to a 27-1 season.The latter number is the one that matters to Banks.‚ÄúI love winning,‚Äù he said.He was the primary reason Tartan did so much of it this season. Banks is a crafty guard who can shoot the lights out and score from three levels while changing speeds and direction to generate advantages.That combination allowed Banks to put up big numbers effectively on demand. Yet Klingsporn noted there were also games when the guard would score only 10 points, because that‚Äôs all that was required to win.The guard‚Äôs biggest development this season was as a leader. Tartan heavily featured a pair of freshmen this season. Banks took the younger players under his wing and made a point to emphasize communication.But he also led with his approach.‚ÄúTeam is the most important thing for him,‚Äù Klingsporn said. ‚ÄúAnd it was, quite frankly, for a lot of our kids, and that‚Äôs why we were really good together. We had a bunch of selfless kids.‚ÄùBanks noted this year‚Äôs team ‚Äúloved to play together.‚Äù‚ÄúEverybody liked each other,‚Äù he said. ‚ÄúWe were all unselfish. And it just helped us.‚ÄùBut Banks was the head of the snake.Throughout high school, he gained more and more understanding of how to play with proper tempo and controlled games on a nightly basis. That allowed Tartan to win its first 27 games of the season and become a top-five team in Class 4A. The Titans‚Äô lone loss was a five-point loss in the Class 4A, Section 4 final to Cretin-Derham Hall, the top team in the state.The Titans put a thorough scare into the Raiders, leading by 13 at the break. Banks finished with 26 points.‚ÄúHe was really good. He gave us a fighting chance in that game to beat that team,‚Äù Klingsporn said. ‚ÄúWe fought them tooth and nail.‚ÄùWhat else would you expect from a guy who always seemed to deliver his best in the biggest moments? Banks‚Äô incremental progression was a product, Klingsporn noted, of who the guard is as a person.‚ÄúHe‚Äôs a high-character kid. He allows himself to be coached. He‚Äôs a selfless kid. If you allow yourself to be coached, you‚Äôre a selfless kid and you‚Äôre a good teammate, those are three things that really stick out to me,‚Äù Klingsporn said. ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre going to allow yourself to progress as a basketball player, because there‚Äôs nothing blocking you from not progressing, as long as you‚Äôre putting the time in.‚ÄùThe guard is highly appreciative of the support and teaching he has received from Klingsporn. Banks remains uncommitted to a college program, but Klingsporn noted he is garnering interest.Banks knows what he wants from his next program.‚ÄúJust a coach who‚Äôs straight up with me, who has a plan for me,‚Äù he said.Because he knows how helpful that was for his development at the high school level.‚ÄúQuite frankly, I think people have made a mistake in not recruiting him higher,‚Äù said Klingsporn, who has developed a number of Division-I players during his hall of fame, 700-plus win coaching career. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs the type of kid that every coach really wants to have on their team.‚ÄùTommy Ahneman, senior center, Cretin-Derham Hall: Notre Dame commit averaged 18 points, 11 rebounds and 3.5 blocks for the top team in Class 4A.Jojo Mitchell, junior guard, Cretin-Derham Hall: Playmaker averaged 17 points and six assists while guiding the Raiders to state.Ty Schlagel, sophomore wing, Cretin-Derham Hall: The state‚Äôs top recruit in the Class of 2027, he averaged 19 points and seven rebounds as a sophomore this season.Cedric Tomes, junior guard, East Ridge: All-around player averaged 27 points a game for the Raptors.Camare Young, junior guard, Apple Valley: Lengthy wing averaged north of 18 points and nine rebounds while leading the Eagles back to state.

author: Rob Polansky
title: ‚ÄòNot all patients are humans‚Äô: 14 puppies rescued from rollover vehicle crash
text: WOODSTOCK, CT ( WFSB /Gray News) - Fourteen puppies were rescued from a rollover crash that closed a road in Woodstock, Connecticut Thursday morning. Several fire agencies responded to Senexet Road between Laurel and Bull Hill roads for a single-vehicle rollover accident involving wires down. Firefighters found a pole that had snapped, with wires down, and called Eversource CT to disable the power. Power was out in the area while the electricians worked. Officials say minor injuries were originally reported, but no one ended up being hurt. First responders also rescued and provided care for 14 puppies at the scene. the Muddy Brook Fire Department shared photos on Facebook of firefighters interacting with the puppies. The Necogg Humane Society and a doctor from Peake Brook Veterinary Center responded to the scene to provide veterinary care and shelter to the animals, firefighters said. Some puppies will be taken to a veterinary office for further care. Drivers were warned to expect a ‚Äúlong duration road closure.‚Äù Copyright 2024 WFSB via Gray Media Group, Inc. All rights reserved.
